Decided to start a Nuzlocke of the romhack Red++. Doing the usual rules plus no items in battle and Set. Just got the first badge. Highlights:
>Not catching a Zigzagoon on Route 1 OR Route 2. By highlight I of course mean this is terrible.
>Mankeys are on Route 22. So were Meowths plus the usual suspects, so virtually every R22 Pokemon would have been good. I thought I'd have Rocky as back-up for Pewter but didn't use him.
>Did give him Rock Tomb after the fight though; Bowser can get it too but I'm gonna have him sit some fights out to even out some levels.
>Kakunas (and Metapods presumably) still have Poison Sting and String Shot in their moveset even if you catch them naturally. Poison Sting is so weak that they're still pretty useless at this point though.
>The last Bug Trainer in the Forest is actually pretty tough because Weedles apparently learn Bite now too. Scarier than Brock was.
>Was offered a chance to trade a Pikachu for a Togepi in the museum but I wouldn't have done that even if I could.
>Game has Wondertrade-esque feature that I haven't used yet. Thinking about giving it a shot at some point but not sure what would be fair.
>Despite everything, Brock is still a complete joke.
Looking forward to the five new Pokemon I'll be getting before Misty. Hope I get some of the added Gen II/III mons if they're available... and not Togepi.

posts.com:
work's done! update time!

in a time slightly later from whence we left off, we return. By now, Hairdo had a plan. He was going to bring Tex and Daga to the doctor, and reunite with his team. It just felt... wrong, to keep going after Snorkel himself, especially without any real idea of where the Patrat could've gone. So, instead, he picked up Daga and began escorting her and Tex as he'd decided. While the escort mission commenced, Hairdo and Tex got to know each other. Daga would sometimes chime in with a joke, and the pair would laugh, but the trip otherwise went smoothly- save for the occasional stops for some training.

Upon returning to his team, however, Hairdo was immediately met with a strong hug from Tea- who immediately began blubbering about how thankful he was for saving them. Hairdo took the opportunity to take all the credit- only for Daga to chime in and correct him, leading to some playful irritation between the two. Tex was there giggling the whole time, as was Sylvia.
And Sylvia! She, along with the other now-rested members of the group, quickly took to praising Hairdo and Daga, seriously and not (Hannah was still joking, because when is she not). Even Pillow, despite the fact that she was noticeably on-edge.

This playful atmosphere continued as everyone made their way towards Nimbasa City. By now, navigating the sandstorm was second nature to most of them, so getting to the city was hardly much of an issue. Especially with how bright it was.
The way there was filled with plenty of jokes and serious talks. The group had gone through something traumatic- and it showed. Thankfully, however, they all took it in stride. Tea even went the extra mile and reenacted his pummeling of Plasma grunts to an aptly-horrified Tex, who reacted by swearing fealty to the team and promising their utmost protection, which got even more laughs out of everyone.
Tex was the only one not laughing.

Eventually, however, the band of travelers arrived in Nimbasa...

[cntd]

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53191100
...only to be ambushed again!
By a pair of pop singers!!

A pair of Minccino was the first thing everyone saw, greeting them at the gates and singing a very poppy song to the group. The female on the right did most of the singing, though the male on the left had a whole section to himself and provided good backup. Both of them held a microphone each, and introduced themselves as Mr. Biggie and Itty-Bitty- the Big-Time Bros.

At the end of their performance, Mr. Biggie held out a small hat and motioned for tips, while Itty-Bitty just made a cute face. A very Charming face, indeed. Quite Cute.
Clearly their efforts worked some kind of magic, because Sylvia pushed to the front to tip them both immediately. She was nearly told off by Pillow... but when the Munna came over to chastise Sylvia for spending money where it wasn't needed, she hesitated.
A thought came to her head before she could say anything, her mouth just hanging open for a second. This city was supposed to be entertaining, right? So... what was the harm in tipping a pair of singers trying to make that entertainment a reality?

Pillow retreated, and the Minccino got their tips.
In fact, even as the gang continued on to touring the rest of the city, the pair of rodents persisted. Biggie would sometimes crack a joke when nobody was talking, eliciting a snicker or two from one of the boys. Bitty would point out something interesting about the city that'd wow plenty of members of the group.
Sylvia remained impressed throughout, even making efforts to befriend Bitty while the Bros bothered them, until eventually requesting that they join the team.

Surprisingly, when Bitty eagerly obliged, nobody on the team batted an eye. Everyone just laid back, accepted it, and continued having fun.

Tea had a big battle coming up, after all. They needed to save their fighting skills for later.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Unfortunately, Tex would never get to show off his fighting skills.

After leaving a highly-anticipated Football game, he got into a spat with a Darumaka trying to steal the Plume Fossil that he'd brought to the game to have some company.

While the two fought, the Darumaka struck a killing blow before Tex could land his own, and it took Hannah fighting the ape off to retrieve the fossil.


After Tex's death, the team was hit hard. Everyone took several days to recuperate, trying to remember the reality of the situation through the fog of the Nimbasan entertainment overwhelming their senses, and all of them turned up their own ways of dealing with the loss (as seen in pic rel).
The Big-Time Bros offered to fight in Tex's stead, but Bitty convinced them to back down after Sylvia asked them not to and Pillow politely declined.

The team took a detour back to Nacrene to revive the fossil in Tex's honor, now being accompanied by a childish and bratty Archen named Robbie, before getting together and coming up with a plan.

They would grind like hell, beat the gym, and win.
And when that was all said and done, they'd go watch some football and beat the shit out of that Darumaka if they saw it.

>>53185858
The devs decided to determine Spinda's pattern by splitting the 32-bit personality value into 4 8-bit chunks that represent each spot's y and x positions:
>first 4 bits: left face spot y coordinate
>next 4 bits: left face spot x coordinate
>next 4 bits: right face spot y coordinate
>next 4 bits: right face spot x coordinate
>next 4 bits: left ear spot y coordinate
>next 4 bits: left ear spot x coordinate
>next 4 bits: right ear spot y coordinate
>last 4 bits: right ear spot x coordinate

Those last 8 bits are also used to calculate gender, which is done by checking if that chunk is greater or equal to a specific value. On a mon with a 1:1 ratio like Spinda, this works out so that the first 4 bits of the gender chunk in male mons are always* greater or equal to 8 - since this is also the y-coordinate of the right ear spot (keep in mind that vidya coordinates almost always treat positive y as down), male Spinda always* have lower spots than females.

*Incidentally, the gender ratio actually is skewed in favor of males, but only because the programmers used a greater than equal comparison instead of a greater one - the real ratio is 129/127. As such, there's a 1/129 chance that a male Spinda can have the same right ear spot height as a female.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53179987
>Cubone at least has multihits, and a 2 hit ranged attack
In theory, you are correct.
In practice, there are some problems with that:
Cubone learns Bone Rush at Level 41. That's well into the postgame, so that doesn't help you with the parts of them game that both Cubone and Machop struggle the most with.
Bonemerang is learn upon Level 25. If you play through the game without grinding, you typically reach that around Magma Cavern/Sky Tower.
Sky Tower is particular is filled with Flying Types and Pokemon that have levitate, so it isn't nearly as useful as you might think. Also, the accuracy is terrible.

After Rayquaza, you can reliably farm gummies and TMs so the difference between the two becomes rather insignificant, at least in my experience.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>53180059
Sometimes your starter is your least worst option post Rayquaza.
Most of them are gonna struggle, because the dungeons after Sky Tower pick up significantly in difficulty.
Most importantly, you absolutely need an anwer to Monster houses at that point. And barely any starters have that, since Earthquake is terribly unreliable. The only starter to have that is Charmander, since Charizard can learn Heatwave immediately (Problem being of course that you have to grind another 10 leveln on average, but basically every starter needs to grind lul).
I used to just go recruit Arcticuno immideately for that reason, since it come high level and with an excellent movepool that includes Powder Snow. Problem with that is or course its size. Your teams combined Size cannot exceed 6, and Articuno already has a size of 4, so you cannot use it to recruit most of the other big legendaries.
honestly, the best way to play the original rescue team ist probably to pick Charmandar as a starter along with something busted to carry you until postgame, then dump all your gummies into Charmandar all at once and solo the rest of the game with Charizard.

>>53143716
welp, blogpost time. I'll spoiler it so people who don't give a shit can keep scrolling.
I mainly went to Vegas because the Las Vegas Open, which is the biggest convention for tabletop wargames was being held at the Rio, and I participated in the championship tournament for Warhammer 40k. Unfortunately, on the 4th of my 6 games, my biggest model had broken, so I dropped out. That was really my biggest disappointment, but I had fun nonetheless. I was crashing with a friend who had an apartment there, so I didn't have to stay at the decrepit hotel.
Other activities involved losing money at gambling (sorry, Dawn), firing guns at Battlefield Vegas, killing zombies in virtual reality, eating at Guy Fieri's burger restaurant and at Din Tai Fung, and visiting a bunch of the famous hotels on the strip, as well as the Atomic Testing Museum and the Omega Mart. I have a feeling I've forgotten one or two things.

>>53190465
The problem with leon is that they worked backwards from the idea "he's the strongest" and then didn't bother to do anything with that idea. You're just supposed to accept that he's the strongest because he is, and him being the strongest is why you should like him. The anime is far more egregious about this because even his meager development in the game is more than he gets in the anime, where he also gets shilled way more.

So you have a character who's a total empty vessel getting juiced up by the showrunners without actually showing us why he matters or earning that reputation. Moreover, the wins he gets in the anime are meaningless because they're just checkboxes to get him to the end of the tournament, because he's this gen's shill character so he HAS to go to the end. There's no stakes to his character; he's just a plot device to hand Ash a championship so they can shuffle him out the door.

It's honest to god disastrous writing. Embarrassing on every level.

I'm fairly certain I remember this. I remember that era of internet intellectualism, too, especially here on 4chan. It's especially easy to pinpoint the time period thanks to the artwork (overly detailed B&W scribbling) and the usage of exclusively Gen 1 Pokemon iconography as per nostalgia... though the date on the stadium has me second-guessing it.

Cynical realism is liberating because, once you're sufficiently educated, you can attain a sort of bitter enlightenment and see beyond the world's bullshit. We must all strive toward it. However, this state is an inherently miserable existence and ultimately a futile pursuit as the awareness accomplishes nothing and will not make you happy. At the end, the Pikachu has become burdened by his experiences and now, like his trainer, he can only escape them by passing the unfair burden of knowledge on to another.

>>53161862
>Give it +10pts in SpAtt, bringing BST to 530 and SpAtt to 110
>Buff Illuminate so that it increases your Accuracy +2 each time you use a "light" move (happens before the attack goes off) and each time you are hit with a Dark move (happens after damage). This way there's a specific set up condition that isn't as simple as switching in. You reap the benefit for setting it up but it also means that people just can't send in this Pokémon and start spammimg Blizzard. Light moves would be moves like Dazzling Gleam, a lot of the Beam moves, etc.
>Replace Analytic with Hydration or Regenerator. Either makes way more sense and neither takes away from it also having Natural Cure as well
>Keep Meteor Beam and Flip Turn in its base moveset (they were cut from BDSP). It already learns a lot of really good offensive moves, but I would also give it access to Energy Ball, Whirlpool, Chilling Water, Acid Spray and Stored Power. I'm going to assume it would also get Tera Blast and Ice Spinner, even if the second is kinda pointless.
>Give it back a lot of the status moves it lost in Gen 8: Swagger, Psych Up, Confide, Reflect Type, Camouflage, Toxic and Spotlight. It already has Cosmic Power, but let's give it Acupressure and Growth too. It has such a wide move pool that I don't want it to feel overpowered if it's going to get Accuracy boosts on top of access to Nasty Plot or CM. Acupressure makes sense because it's a sea star, and I feel like Growth would be an interesting gimmicky setup move that does make sense on it. I also really want it to have Autotomize and Coil, because it's a goddamn sea star. Why wouldn't it be able to cut off a limb or curl up its body? Both would be super gimmicky as well but fun set up moves nonetheless

All right, how did I do? I'm already picturing a Doubles set that uses something like Dazzling Gleam, Hydro Pump, Thunder and Blizzard with Illuminate and holding a Weakness Policy w an ally using Brutal Swing

>Overtime, most mention of Pokémon being eaten by either humans or Pokémon in any manner has become increasingly rare. This may be due to moral issues; as the anime and games progressed, Pokémon became seemingly more human-like. This included displaying individual personalities, human mannerisms, and complex emotions. In most cultures and societies, the idea of human beings eating each other is strictly taboo, so much so that even the idea of fictional creatures eating one another would seem equally cannibalistic if they possessed any human qualities. However, in Pokémon Sword and Shield, Barraskewda and Appletun are both stated to be popular foods for humans.

>Some Pokémon have even been given new dietary habits, possibly in an attempt to downplay any predatory behaviors. An example of this would be Aerodactyl, which was originally suggested to be carnivorous, but is later shown to eat fruit. In the original series, Ash's Pokédex states "Its hard fangs suggest it might have been a carnivore. Its sharp claws were probably used to capture prey." Even in the games, Aerodactyl's Pokédex entries mention it tearing the throats out of its enemies. In Attack of the Prehistoric Pokémon, Aerodactyl was even shown going for Ash's throat. However, in Putting the Air Back in Aerodactyl!, the fossilized Aerodactyl egg Gary used to resurrect the Pokémon was found near fossilized seed remains. After Aerodactyl escaped, it was only calmed down when fed a pear-like fruit that was a similar DNA match to the seeds. This would imply that Aerodactyl regularly fed on the fruit, implying that it was an herbivore or an omnivore.

People forget that Generation 1 had hundreds upon hundreds of designs for monsters that pretty much all were based on pop culture before anything else. The final 151 that we got to a Western audience seem like they were based on generic RPG monsters and things like that, which some of them were, but they have far more influences from Japanese culture than we are aware of. Like a third of the fucking Pokémon in Gen 1 are just things from Dragon Quest or Ultraman, it's not hard to imagine the rest are also based on crap that we don't know very well here and that they are probably all each a hodgepodge of several ideas that would have been familiar to Gen Xer Japanese game devs in the early to mid '90s

The gyaru fashion first started in the 70s having its peak between 1989-1999, Jynx's Japanese name (ルージュラ) is the same as a cosmetic brand popularly used by these girls, and both Jynx and a subcategory of this fashion are based on a yokai Yama-Uba or Yamamba, an old woman from the mountains in a red dress (due to blood in some stories) and golden or platinum hair.

For greater coincidence, Smochun has a haircut and a stylized body to that of the infant Kintaro, a legendary hero who was raised by a yama-uba.

I'm not saying that Jynx is inspired by this, just that both having a common source (Yama-Uba) it's normal for them to look alike.

In Norse mythology, Dökkálfar ("Dark Elves") and Ljósálfar ("Light Elves") are two contrasting types of elves; the dark elves dwell within the earth and have a dark complexion, while the light elves live in Álfheimr, and are "fairer than the sun to look at". The Ljósálfar and the Dökkálfar are attested in the Prose Edda, written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson, and in the late Old Norse poem Hrafnagaldr Óðins. Scholars have produced theories about the origin and implications of the dualistic concept.

In Norse cosmology, svartálfar (O.N. "black elves", "swarthy elves", sing. svartálfr), also called myrkálfar ("dark elves", "dusky elves", "murky elves", sing. myrkálfr),[1][2] are beings who dwell in Svartalfheim (Svartálf[a]heimr, "home of the black-elves").[3] Both the svartálfar and Svartálfaheimr are primarily attested in the Prose Edda, written in the 13th century by Snorri Sturluson. Scholars have noted that the svartálfar appear to be synonymous with the dwarfs and potentially also the dökkálfar ("dark elves"). As dwarfs, the home of the svartálfar could possibly be another description for Niðavellir ("dark fields").

>>53189727
I'll give a summary:
>Old Norse dark elves
In ancient times, the word "elf" wasn't as specific as it was today. It was used more generally for some kinds of humanoid supernatural beings, there was even a story of a human king dying and being worshipped as an elf. Now, since "elf" was a pretty vague word it could also be applied to dwarves, like the dwarf named Gandálfr (Means "Staff-elf", literally where Tolkien got the name from.) This extended to the group known as dark elves, which was essentially another name for dwarves, the same little midgets living in the earth and master craftsmen that we all know and love.
>Tolkien dark elves
Tolkien loved Norse mythology, so he referenced dark elves, but he made them separate from dwarves. In his version, dark elves looked exactly the same as other elves, the same light-skinned knife ears. The only reason they were called dark elves was because they never saw the light of his magical trees.
>DnD-inspired dark elves
DnD based a lot of its lore on Tolkien, so they ended up using the concept of dark elves and changed them around. Now they were dark as in they literally were black-skinned and evil elves. After DnD's popularity spike, modern fantasy basically started copying it along with the concept of dark elves but with different interpretations of what dark should imply. Sometimes their modern dark elves are basically just latino elves, anime prefers this style of dark elf. Other times they'd go with the all out black bondage gear elves which many consider to be the true modern dark elf.
